title: 1D kinematics - change in velocity of sprinter

content.question: Interval name Average Speed Final Position <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> <math alttext="5.0 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math> <math alttext="25 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>25</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></math> <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> <math alttext="4.0 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math> <math alttext="0 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="0.4em"></mspace><mn>0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></math> <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> <math alttext="6.0 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>6.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math> <math alttext="75 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>75</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></math> <math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi></math> <math alttext="2.0 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math> <math alttext="0 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="0.4em"></mspace><mn>0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></math> <math alttext="E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi></math> <math alttext="7.0 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>7.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math> <math alttext="50 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>50</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></math> An athlete sprints back and forth along a straight track. The athlete starts at a position of <math alttext="0 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></math>, and the athlete’s average speed and final position are shown in the table for five successive time intervals. Assume the athlete has a constant speed during each interval and quickly changes direction during the transitions between intervals. During which transition does the athlete’s change in velocity have the greatest magnitude?

choices.label: The transition between intervals <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>.

The transition between intervals <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> and <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>.

The transition between intervals <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> and <math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi></math>.

The transition between intervals <math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi></math> and <math alttext="E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi></math>.

content.answer: The transition between intervals <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> and <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>.

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
